title: Official (Sorta) Keen Sightings Topic
content:
Post places where you found keen, 314, 315, yorps, gargs, whatever. (I think there used to be a topic like this, but i don't know) Oh, yeah, no Dopefish (Too common).

Also, be sure to give credit to the original finder of them (or put "unknown")
I'll put everyones posts in this first post.

Official:



Unofficial:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yarkovsky-O%27Keefe-Radzievskii-Paddack_effect]YORP Effect[/url]
- Genius314

In an episode of Spongebob, there is a Bus sign that is blurry at one point, appearing to say "315"
- Genius314

In an episode of Danny Phantom, they go to a mansion in Wisconsin, there's Packers helmets everywhere, and at one point they say "Mortified" and "Pogo."
- Genius314 (Someone else mentioned the helmet once, but I noticed more!! :-P)

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E-Series]Sonic the Hedgehog: E-Series[/url]
The robot, "E-10000r," is nicknamed "Robo Red."
-Genius314

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/314/315WaterHeater1.jpg http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/314/melbournetelligent.jpg http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/314/threedollarfifteen.jpg http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/314/keenzuma.jpg http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/314/315Online.png
-Commander Spleen

(NOTE: What is this from? You named two movies)
Keymaker: Once the door is unprotected, the connection will be severed. But another connection must first be made.
Ghost: How long will that take?
Keymaker: Exactly 314 seconds.
-Commander Spleen

[url=http://nerd-boy.net/nbbrowse.php?beg=311&end=320#314]Nerdboy Episode 314[/url]
-Commander Spleen/KeenRush

Psyconauts
When you're talking to Lily on the dock (while everyone behind you is learning levitation) Lily mentions that what's going on is "...Just like in True Psychic Tales Issue 314!"
-Kudos

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v177/memsys/314.jpg-memsys

In spongebob the movie the big day that the new snackbar opens, you know with the camera zooming in at the calendar, is march 14.
-EZjay (although I think someone else mentioned this about a year ago)


So... Go find some!! :-)-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Three Fourteen
content:
Two movies I can remember (I'm sure there are more) that have 314 references are Mission: Impossible and Matrix Reloaded.

[url=http://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Job%203%20;&version=76;]Job 3:14[/url], which is a solid theme throughout the entire movie.

Keymaker: Once the door is unprotected, the connection will be severed. But another connection must first be made.
Ghost: How long will that take?
Keymaker: Exactly 314 seconds.

In addition to that, I have a bunch of images.

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/314/315WaterHeater1.jpghttp://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/314/melbournetelligent.jpghttp://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/314/threedollarfifteen.jpghttp://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/314/keenzuma.jpghttp://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/314/315Online.png
There's another to come--I bought some grapes the other day, which registered as $3.14 and rounded up to $3.15. I'll post the docket once I've scanned it. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: NERD BOY!!
content:
I was searching up information about ASCII art, and ended up at a wikipedia article that led me to [url=http://nerd-boy.net/index.php]The Adventures of Nerd Boy[/url]. After reading a bunch of strips, I sent KeenRush there, whereupon he noticed [url=http://nerd-boy.net/nbbrowse.php?beg=311&end=320#314]this[/url].

I sent the following email to Joaquim Gndara, Nerd Boy's creator:
[hr]Spleen Do I smell an extremely subtle reference to Commander Keen? Or am I an idiot reading too much into things again?[hr]
To which he replied:
[hr]JG Since I have played those games, I thought you might have stumbled upon some reference that -- unbeknowst to even myself -- had sneaked its way into a strip. Looking at the strip, I can't find anything that suggests a Commander Keen reference. The only way I can read it is as I intended it; Nerd Boy is smart, and Fan Boy is stupid. What was your interpretation?[hr]
I explained:
[hr]Spleen Commander Keen's IQ is 314, so it's an interesting fluke that Episode 314 happens to feature IQ as its theme. We Keeners are always on the lookout for occurances of 314, regardless of their inherent meaning. Here's another to add to the list.
[hr]
So, there we have a random unwitting Keen reference to add to our collection. Apparently I'm an idiot reading too much into things again. Hooray!

Hehe, Nerd Boy rocks.

And a final reply on the topic:
[hr]JG Whooo, that's actually pretty awesome! Of course, now I wish I'd googled
"keen 314" before I replied just so I could've pretended it was on purpose.
Blast!

Glad you like the strips. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
[hr] Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Re:
content: "Sitings" isn't a correct word in any dictionary I possess, nor is it a word on [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/search?q=sitings]Dictionary.com.[/url] "Siting" is a word, however, but it doesn't mean the same thing as "sighting".

title: Re: Si*GH*tings
content:
Sightings, technically correct; derived from sight and sighted.

Sitings; correct, derived from site and sited [as in sited at]

Ah English!

bart: wow homeslice, either you did a job right for once, or you broke down and hired a pro.

homer: as I lay covered with paste and wallpaper, I thought back to the days of our forefathers, and wondered, what would they have done?

title: Re: Brother Chaps
content:
Ok time to post something that isn't a number.

OMG Gal! References to Commander Keen that DOESN'T use the 314-315 numbers?! IMPOSSIBLE!

Yes indeed.

Some... probably a LOT of you know what Homestar Runner is... (Only the COOL kids know. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] )
Well the Brother Chaps and They May be Giants teamed up like... a year ago or something and made a music video called "Experimental film."

For those of you that haven't watched it, [url=http://www.homestarrunner.com/expfilm.html]here is the link.[/url]
(It's pretty good.)

Anyway near the end of the song the ATM (Which is a main theme through the music video) chases a crapily drawn Strong Sad. (The grey fat guy.) Well the ATM is wearing a yellow, faceguardless football helmet with a blue stripe down the middle.

[img]http://img102.imageshack.us/img102/6527/exfilmwm9.png[/img]
Keen reference? Maybe... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

I know this is an old video... and I don't know why I didn't submit this before... But anyway here you go.

Also there have been some, what I think, are maybe minor references to Commander Keen in some of the other Brother's Chaps stuff but I don't remember what they are or which cartoons they are in.-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Brother Chaps
content:
Sorry for the double post. But I found something a little interesting today...

Okay so I was poking around on Wikipedia following random links when I followed one to the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BFG9000]BFG9000[/url]... you know... that big gun from the Doom series...

Well reading down they mentioned the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BFG9000#Incarnations]different incarnations[/url] of the BFG. Well the last paragraph in that section used to state this.

[quote]Quote:[hr]The BFG in the Doom movie is identified, on a computer monitor, as "Bio Force Gun version 3.14". The number is possibly in reference to the games [the 3] and Section 14 of Tom Hall's original Doom design document [the .14] (it also could just be the number pi). Unlike in the video games, the gun is not labeled as '9000'.[hr][/quote]

Woah woah wait wait wait ...
let me quote that again...
[quote]Quote:[hr]The number is possibly in reference to the games [the 3] and Section 14 of Tom Hall's original Doom design document [the .14][hr][/quote]
Oh so it has NO reference to Tom Hall's earlier creation known to the world as "Commander Keen?"
Honestly that is a bigger stretch than what some of YOU posted in this thread. And you guys are pretty bad.

I took on the liberty of rectifying this.
It now reads:

[quote]Quote:[hr]The BFG in the Doom movie is identified, on a computer monitor, as "Bio Force Gun version 3.14". The number is most likely a reference to one of Tom Hall's earliest computer game creations, Commander Keen, who's intelligence quotient is at 314. It has also been speculated that the number is a reference to the number of Doom games [the 3] and Section 14 of Tom Hall's original Doom design document [the .14] (Though it also could just be the number pi). Unlike in the video games, the gun is not labeled as '9000'.[hr][/quote]
(Stupid Doom fanboys... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] )

ANYWAY...

I know TMST put it in Strife Toons ep.1 (WHERE IS EPISODE 3 SLUGGY?!) But since it cropped up I guess I should say it again here. Yes in the Doom movie (Which I never saw mind you.) there is the BFG 314.-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: OMG, it's SGA!!!
content:
I wonder if SGA sightings count too:

- Screen 1: [img]http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/images/sgaduke1.jpg[/img]
- Screen 2: [img]http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/images/sgaduke2.jpg[/img]

I had to upload them to my website. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke.gif[/img]
Well, I was playing some fan-made maps with eDuke32 and the Duke 3D High Resolution Pack (latest unofficial external release), when I found a picture at the exit of a level. I suddenly realized it had SGA letters on it, so I went to E2L9 to check the original place were those textures were originally used, and I took the screenshots linked above.

The SGA letters are upside down in the texture, and some of them are even horizontally reflected. Enjoy. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] [hr]SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: OMG, it's SGA!!!
content:
What! I play DN3D HRP regulary and I didn't even notice... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img]

EDIT: I did see a computer booting Linux though, and the screen saying "bastard..." if you shoot it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: OMG, it's SGA!!!
content:
The guys that make the Duke Nukem 3D Hi-res pack seem to have made a large number of Keen cameos in it.

Anyways, I was wondering two days ago... in Jazz Jackrabbit 1, planet "Tubelectric" (I think it's in episode one), there's a strange enemy with some resemblance to Keen5's Volte-face. It has almost the same eyes, with the difference that they don't spin, moves slowly horizontally and flashes.

I should get a screenshot of it.------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

title: BOY! I'S KEEN!
content:
Alright! I don't know how can nobody ever noticed this:
[img]http://img444.imageshack.us/img444/4483/snap194co9.jpg[/img]

MCF (Mystery Case Files) series are by BigFishGames where your primary goal is to find objects on the screen. If you don't know these series, you may try them and [url=http://www.mysterycasefiles.com/]check out the site[/url]. They are very addictive and very well done.

The upper image was taken from MCF: Ravenhearst (the third from the series). Notice the helmet? You'll say "It's just an ordinary helmet. And it's not even yellow!".

Ok, nothing special here? Wait for this:
[img]http://img483.imageshack.us/img483/8350/snap193ox1.jpg[/img]

Coincidence? I think not! It's obvious that the authors of the Mystery Case Files series are Commander Keen lovers. And when I saw this I was "WOW!"

Furthermore, I've noticed one yellow helmet (a suspiciously Keen looking one) in MCF: Huntsville. I've noticed it long before the other two games came out, but wasn't sure to post it here or not. I believe there is one more helmet in this game, but I don't remember well.

Also, there is one Keen reference in MCF: Prime Suspects too.

I'm unable to go to their locations and take screenshots to show you because I have to start playing these games from the beginning. And this takes a loong time.

So I truly believe the authors are Commander Keen fans [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] . And I was thinking of asking them if they really mean these as a Keen references.----

[img]http://img294.imageshack.us/img294/1923/untitled116qa.gif[/img]
Tough Bloogs eat princesses

title: Re: BOY! I'S KEEN!
content:
Hey Shadow Master; the JJ1 enemies are officially known as 'Will o Wisps' and are also found in JJ2, where they are *much* more Volte Faceish.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: BOY! I'S KEEN!
content:
Cool find! That ping pong/PaddleWar machine with 'Boy! It's Keen' has got to be referring to Keen. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] If not, it's one garging good coincidence. As said, it seems likely they still remember Keen. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
